page.title: 01Ayrshire Upland Border
page.content: This is a watershed area of rolling upland over 700 feet above sea-level. It lies in the lee of Loudoun Hill - a local landmark. Although moorland there are good plantings of beeech trees round lower fields. The land which was glaciated is snad, peat and thin soil, therefore land use is marginal agriculture with forestry creeping in the area is sparsely populated - most peopel are involved in farming-barley, hay, rough-grazing and moor. The isolated primary school has been converted to an outdoor centre. The block contains the battlefield of Drumclog where the religious covenanters beat the Dragoons in 1679. The area appears to be little changed over the years except for the pressure on marginal land for forestry use.
